p: While the focus on this paper is on the statistical weighting methodology by trend and variability performance, the simplicity of the decomposition into trend and variability (e.g., lowess method or linear detrending) deserves mention. The nonlinear trends discussed here may include residual contributions from long-term internal climate variability. However, this can be handled by the trend-weighting part of the method since this part accounts for long-term model error [ 35]. The unfiltered long-term variability in each model can be simply considered as part of this long-term model error. Previous work provides examples of using a more sophisticated decomposition [ 18]. Improving the decomposition methodology is beyond the scope of the paper, and is subject of future work.
